Gardner and select members of the Justice League go to Oa to find out why so many Green Lanterns have gone missing and find trouble while there.", "description": "<p>Emerald Fallout is a story arc that lasted for four issues of <a data-ref-id=\"4050-11894\" href=\"/guy-gardner-warrior/4050-11894/\" slug=\"guy-gardner-warrior\">Guy Gardner: Warrior</a> from March to June 1994.</p><h2>Plot Summary</h2><p>It is a time of transition for <a data-ref-id=\"4005-1791\" href=\"/guy-gardner/4005-1791/\" slug=\"guy-gardner\">Guy Gardner</a>. Recently his <a data-ref-id=\"4055-53415\" href=\"/sinestro-corps-ring/4055-53415/\" slug=\"sinestro-corps-ring\">yellow ring</a> lost much of its power and as such feelings of inadequacy pervaded his conscience and his sense of duty. The story begins with <a data-ref-id=\"4005-2055\" href=\"/general-glory/4005-2055/\" slug=\"general-glory\">General Glory</a> repairing a wall of Gardner''s apartment, offering his apologies for having run the latter through it over a physical conflict that occurred a week prior to the events of this story. It would seem then for a hard-knock hero like Guy Gardner that it was just another typical day.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-img-src=\"https://static.comicvine.com/uploads/original/8/82159/1750004-guygardner2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1750004\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.71336206896552\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:71.3%\" href=\"https://static.comicvine.com/uploads/original/8/82159/1750004-guygardner2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1750004\"><img alt=\"Gardner''s vision\" src=\"https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/82159/1750004-guygardner2.jpg\" srcset=\"https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/original/8/82159/1750004-guygardner2.jpg 2320w, https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/scale_super/8/82159/1750004-guygardner2.jpg 960w, https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/82159/1750004-guygardner2.jpg 480w, https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/82159/1750004-guygardner2.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></a><figcaption>Gardner''s vision</figcaption></figure><p>Unfortunately it was not to be just any normal day for Guy. Out of nowhere his yellow power ring goes berserk and experiences a massive energy surge that brings visions to Gardner''s conscience. Visions of very vivid and terrible events begin to overcome his mind. He sees <a data-ref-id=\"4005-11202\" href=\"/hal-jordan/4005-11202/\" slug=\"hal-jordan\">Hal Jordan</a> strangling <a data-ref-id=\"4005-10448\" href=\"/sinestro/4005-10448/\" slug=\"sinestro\">Sinestro</a> in one particular hallucination. In another, <a data-ref-id=\"4005-6952\" href=\"/kilowog/4005-6952/\" slug=\"kilowog\">Kilowog</a> seems to have been murdered and is lying dead upon <a data-ref-id=\"4020-41360\" href=\"/oa/4020-41360/\" slug=\"oa\">Oa</a>. Then guy sees Jordan bedecked in a strange looking armor, unaware of the latter''s recent possession by <a data-ref-id=\"4005-41293\" href=\"/parallax/4005-41293/\" slug=\"parallax\">Parallax</a>. Gardner is under the impression that what he saw was nothing more than a nightmare, ignorant of the recent events of the <a data-ref-id=\"4045-41289\" href=\"/emerald-twilight/4045-41289/\" slug=\"emerald-twilight\">Emerald Twilight</a>.</p><p>Gardner''s <a data-ref-id=\"4060-39355\" href=\"/qwardians/4060-39355/\" slug=\"qwardians\">Qwardian</a> ring shorts out as a result of the energized vision and thus he''s forced to look for alternative means of making a difference as a superhero. He grudgingly seeks the expertise of <a data-ref-id=\"4005-2054\" href=\"/blue-beetle-kord/4005-2054/\" slug=\"blue-beetle-kord\">Ted Kord</a>, who fashions Gardner a power suit to compensate for his lack of ring-based power as of late. Though the new suit does raise Gardner''s spirits somewhat, still plenty of hard feelings are left over. After all, in addition to the different power changes he''s experienced, Gardner''s also wondering where <a data-ref-id=\"4005-2051\" href=\"/ice/4005-2051/\" slug=\"ice\">Tora</a> is and has the distinct impression that she''s trying to avoid him. His suspicions are confirmed when <a data-ref-id=\"4005-2048\" href=\"/wonder-woman/4005-2048/\" slug=\"wonder-woman\">Diana</a> tells Gardner that the <a data-ref-id=\"4060-31815\" href=\"/justice-league-of-america/4060-31815/\" slug=\"justice-league-of-america\">League</a> has known of Tora''s whereabouts for some time but counsels Gardner to exercise restraint by adding that she was going through changes of her own and needed time to straighten things out.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-img-src=\"https://static.comicvine.com/uploads/original/8/82159/1750005-guygardner1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1750005\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.4061207609595\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:140.6%\" href=\"https://static.comicvine.com/uploads/original/8/82159/1750005-guygardner1.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1750005\"><img alt=\"Militia''s rage\" src=\"https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/82159/1750005-guygardner1.jpg\" srcset=\"https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/original/8/82159/1750005-guygardner1.jpg 1209w, https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/scale_super/8/82159/1750005-guygardner1.jpg 960w, https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/82159/1750005-guygardner1.jpg 480w, https://comicvine.gamespot.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/82159/1750005-guygardner1.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></a><figcaption>Militia''s rage</figcaption></figure><p>As Gardner is adjusting to his new battle suit, other events are taking place. <a data-ref-id=\"4005-2053\" href=\"/militia/4005-2053/\" slug=\"militia\">Militia</a> as of late is enraged that the <a data-ref-id=\"4060-58221\" href=\"/quorum/4060-58221/\" slug=\"quorum\">Quorum</a> isn''t letting him have another shot at beating Gardner down, though they assure him that his chance will come in due time. Bad blood has been brewing between Gardner and Militia for some time due to prior conflicts. In addition, an interstellar ship is plummeting toward Earth harboring an unnamed member of the <a data-ref-id=\"4060-6992\" href=\"/green-lantern-corps/4060-6992/\" slug=\"green-lantern-corps\">Green Lantern Corps</a> in circumstances not unlike <a data-ref-id=\"4005-22634\" href=\"/abin-sur/4005-22634/\" slug=\"abin-sur\">Abin Sur''s</a> crash landing. Before his ship is destroyed upon orbital entry, however, he comments on the recent mission of <a data-ref-id=\"4005-46405\" href=\"/graf-toren/4005-46405/\" slug=\"graf-toren\">Graf Toren</a> and other Green Lanterns in their attempt to stop Jordan and expresses concern for the others that had gone missing in that venture.</p><p>Taking Diana''s words into account, Gardner goes to the Arctic Circle to seek out Tora and talk with her. Sadly for him, it turns into a war of words between the two estranged lovers. Tora tells him that he is still the same insensitive jerk she had always known while Gardner begs to differ on the matter, claiming that recent events in his life have made him do some serious soul-searching. Just before she can start to accept the fact that maybe Guy has changed, the reunion is quickly disrupted by Militia''s arrival, having been jettisoned from a Quorum submarine that had tracked Gardner to the position in the Arctic he had gone.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-embed-type=\"image\" data-img-src=\"https://static.comicvine.com/uploads/original/8/82159/1749997-guygardner6.jpg\" Gardner</figcaption></figure><p>Militia and Gardner engage one another on the arctic ice shelf in a seesaw battle that goes back and forth between the two, both using their respective power armor in the fight. After gaining the upper hand in the fight, Militia finds himself facing another threat as Tora hoists him effortlessly away from Gardner, a clear allusion to the super strength Tora had recently gained. Militia adapts to this handicap by having the Quorum increase the power of his battle suit so that the two can fight on equal terms. Gardner gets back into the fight just to find that Militia is really his older brother Mace. Eventually his Qwardian ring becomes reactivated, giving him the needed edge to put down Mace for good and win the fight, though he is quick to note that the ring had never had such energy flowing through it prior to this strange impulse.</p><p>Hoping to relax after the fight, Gardner and Tora are interrupted once more by an uninvited character. <a data-ref-id=\"4005-12663\" href=\"/alan-scott/4005-12663/\" slug=\"alan-scott\">Alan Scott</a> comes to tell Guy that he must come with him immediately since a great danger besieges the universe. He mentions to Gardner the intricate connections between all the recent events dealing with the Green Lantern Corps, Gardner''s own experiences and even those relating to Jordan. Recent events like the power surge in the Qwardian ring and the visions that had come as a result of that surge. Also of utmost importance was the recent disappearance of Jordan and other Green Lanterns from Oa and the appearance of a green dome over the area where Coast City once stood. Scott explains these connections and advises that they must be investigated. <a data-ref-id=\"4005-25279\" href=\"/darkstar/4005-25279/\" slug=\"darkstar\">Darkstar</a> <a data-ref-id=\"4005-4608\" href=\"/ferrin-colos/4005-4608/\" slug=\"ferrin-colos\">Ferrin Colos</a> reaffirms Scott''s story with reports of Green Lanterns missing in action across the cosmos. Guy agrees that something must be done and that he must go to Oa to ascertain the truth of what happened to these missing Lanterns. Fortunately for him he would have the aid of Scott, Colos and several select members of the Justice League to assist in this investigation.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-embed-type=\"image\" skull</figcaption></figure><p>Gardner''s team consisted of himself, Scott, Colos, Diana, <a data-ref-id=\"4005-2047\" href=\"/martian-manhunter/4005-2047/\" slug=\"martian-manhunter\">J''onn J''onzz</a>, <a data-ref-id=\"4005-2050\" href=\"/captain-atom/4005-2050/\" slug=\"captain-atom\">Nathaniel Adam</a>, <a data-ref-id=\"4005-2049\" href=\"/the-ray-ray-terrill/4005-2049/\" slug=\"the-ray-ray-terrill\">Ray Terrill</a>, and <a data-ref-id=\"4005-2046\" href=\"/arisia/4005-2046/\" slug=\"arisia\">Arisia</a>. Together they headed off to uncover the mystery of the missing Lanterns. En route to Oa they ran into what seemed to be an asteroid field, prompting Gardner, Scott and Colos to go searching. They found out quickly that the debris in the vacuum were not asteroids but instead bodies of dead Green Lanterns, among them Toren and <a data-ref-id=\"4005-46423\" href=\"/chaselon/4005-46423/\" slug=\"chaselon\">Chaselon</a>. In a nearby space funeral pyre, the three happen to come across an extraterrestrial by the name of Probert, a former Lantern, wrapping up the dead in ceremonial cloth. Probert reveals to them that the culprit behind the mass murders was Jordan himself and that he was still upon Oa. Gardner and the others then proceed to land on the charred planet, finding nothing but death and decay. He is the first to discover the skeletal remains of Kilowog during the impending search, leading to a serious drop in morale among the team members. Shortly thereafter, Jordan comes out of nowhere to savagely attack Gardner and his teammates.</p><p>Everyone on Gardner''s team is summarily defeated in due course by Jordan. None of them prove a match for his newfound entity-based powers. Green adversarial constructs easily subdue Diana while cosmic blasts knock out Arisia. Emerald flames burn into J''onn''s flesh while dark green slime surrounds and consumes Ray, nullifying his light based power. Jordan''s energies coat Adams''s body, rendering him helpless while Darkstar is quickly overcome in the engagement. Even Scott''s <a data-ref-id=\"4055-47348\" href=\"/starheart/4055-47348/\" slug=\"starheart\">Starheart</a>-based ring is unable to even the odds and Jordan ends up capturing every one of Gardner''s teammates, imprisoning them in emerald stasis fields.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-embed-type=\"image\" His furious attacks only stun Jordan initially before the latter gained the upper hand by breaking Gardner''s yellow ring, rendering him powerless once more. Gardner is then struck with such lethal force by Jordan that he crashes into Oa, upon which his battle suit is shattered beyond all hope of repair. Jordan then absorbs the remaining yellow energy and traps Gardner into a stasis field like his comrades. Hal Jordan has gained satisfaction then knowing that nobody will stand in his way of righting the wrongs of the past, however wrong his methods might be. When Logan hits D.C., someone\u2019s going to be waiting for him!", "description": "<h2>Plot Summary</h2><p>Wolverine regained parts of his memories and it\u2019s looking bleak for the organization he\u2019s after. His first order of business is finding the mole in the White House, but as he gets there he finds out that things aren''t going to be that easy. He managed to outsmart <a href=\"/shield/4060-3775/\" data-ref-id=\"4060-3775\"> SHIELD</a> and get to the woman he believes to be the mole but before he got any answers out of her, she was killed by a massive robot. Wolverine quickly defeated the robot by cutting it in half with the <a href=\"/muramasa-blades/4055-54935/\" data-ref-id=\"4055-54935\"> Muramasa</a> blade. The government quickly becomes worried and send in their biggest weapon. A man that Logan has tortured over the years, killed his parents and made him do horrible things in the Vietcong war while he was under the influence of the government. A man upgraded by the government to be the next Wolverine and now he\u2019s ready to face Logan in battle, his name is <a href=\"/nuke/4005-41866/\" data-ref-id=\"4005-41866\"> Nuke</a>.</p><p>As the fight ensues between to the two, Logan is able to cut off both Nuke''s legs but <a href=\"/captain-america/4005-1442/\" data-ref-id=\"4005-1442\"> Captain America</a> comes in out of nowhere and stops Logan before he can finish the job. They fight but Captain America manages to get the upper hand with the help of the Muramasa sword. Captain America believes Nuke is his responsibility for being a failed super soldier but Logan tells him otherwise. When Captain America drops his guard Logan takes advantage of the situation and reverses the roles however <a href=\"/hellion/4005-40454/\" data-ref-id=\"4005-40454\"> Hellion</a>, <a href=\"/cyclops/4005-1459/\" data-ref-id=\"4005-1459\"> Cyclops</a> and <a href=\"/emma-frost/4005-1457/\" data-ref-id=\"4005-1457\"> Emma Frost</a> intervene. After a short skirmish Emma puts an end to the battle and reveals to Logan that he has a son. He survived when <a href=\"/sabretooth/4005-4563/\" data-ref-id=\"4005-4563\"> Sabretooth</a> killed <a href=\"/silver-fox/4005-15696/\" data-ref-id=\"4005-15696\"> Silver Fox</a>, his love. Logan remembers what happened with the help of Emma and leaves, giving the Muramasa sword to Cyclops, knowing that he won\u2019t hesitate to kill him if or when he turns into an animal again. He leaves them to find his son, to make sure he doesn\u2019t become what Logan himself has become.</p><h2>Collected Editions</h2><ul><li><a Brainiac gets a new body created by Luthor, transferring his mind from Milton Fine''s to his newly grown body.", "description": "<p>In \"<em>The Brainiac Trilogy</em>\" (penned by Roger Stern and George Perez) in <i>Action Comics</i> #647-649, Superman reviews recent events and realizes that Luthor and Brainiac must be working together. Brainiac, who seems to have some mental connection to Superman, knows that Superman is aware of him. He acts quickly, taking mental control over Luthor''s aide, Happersen, and eventually the other LexCorp employees. He uses mechanical devices to strengthen his control.</p><p>In <i>Action Comics</i> #649, Brainiac tells Luthor that he worked for the Computer Tyrants on his home planet, Colu. When he failed them, his body was disintegrated. Somehow, his mind survived and was drawn across space to the brain of Milton Moses Fine.</p><p>Meanwhile, Brainiac''s body is submerged in a biochemical bath while it is treated with recombinant DNA and bionic enhancements. Superman arrives just as Brainiac emerges from the tank, now green skinned, with a fit, trim and muscular body. This trivial incident sets of the chain of events that ultimately leads to the widespread carnage of the Apocalypse War.</p><p>With the pent-up pressures of life in the overcrowded, claustrophobic atmosphere of <a data-ref-id=\"4020-55790\" href=\"/mega-city-one/4020-55790/\" slug=\"mega-city-one\">Mega-City One</a>, block wars are a common occurance. But when fighting breaks out between Enid Blyton and Dan Tanna, the violence spreads through the northern sectors like wildfire - swiftly descending into total lawlessness that soon engulfs the entire city.</p><p><a data-ref-id=\"4005-53624\" href=\"/chief-judge-griffin/4005-53624/\" slug=\"chief-judge-griffin\">Chief Judge Griffin</a> entrusts Dredd to stamp out the increasing anarchy, but it is a battle that cannot be won. <a data-ref-id=\"4060-56414\" href=\"/judges-of-mega-city-one/4060-56414/\" slug=\"judges-of-mega-city-one\">Justice Department</a> is unable to cope with 800 million out of control citizens on the rampage. When even Judges defect to join in the chaos, it is apparent that something is seriously wrong. Eventually it is revealed that the madness is the work of a sinister Sov agent named <a data-ref-id=\"4005-14496\" href=\"/orlok/4005-14496/\" slug=\"orlok\">Orlok</a>, who has infected the entire city with polluted water, spread by rain from weather control.</p><p>With Mega-City One severely weakened, the Sov''s strike against the city and launch the <a data-ref-id=\"4045-56740\"
